intro: Conostegia multiflora, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Conostegia multiflora is often found in sandy or well-drained soils and is adapted to dry or seasonally dry environments.
